title: Birds nesting in agricultural lands more vulnerable to extreme heat, study finds
description: As climate change intensifies extreme heat, farms are becoming less hospitable to nesting birds, a new study found. That could be another barrier to maintaining rapidly eroding biodiversity that also provides benefits to humans, including farmers who get free pest control when birds eat agricultural pests.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Coin tosses are not 50/50: Researchers find a slight bias
description: Want to get a slight edge during a coin toss? Check out which side is facing upwards before the coin is flipped –- then call that same side.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Back on the menu? Europeans once ate seaweed, research shows
description: Europeans now rarely eat seaweed, but it was an important part of their diet until the late Middle Ages, archaeologists said Tuesday, calling for the eco-friendly aquatic plant to be put back on the menu.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: To find out how wildlife is doing, scientists try listening
description: A reedy pipe and a high-pitched trill duet against the backdrop of a low-pitched insect drone. Their symphony is the sound of a forest, and is monitored by scientists to gauge biodiversity.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Hurricanes are now twice as likely to zip from minor to whopper than decades ago, study says
description: With warmer oceans serving as fuel, Atlantic hurricanes are now more than twice as likely as before to rapidly intensify from wimpy minor hurricanes to powerful and catastrophic, a study said Thursday.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: 'Mind-blowing': Astronomers spot most distant radio burst yet
description: Eight billion years ago, something happened in a distant galaxy that sent an incredibly powerful blast of radio waves hurtling through the universe.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Researchers: The climate impact of plastic pollution is negligible—the production of new plastics is the real problem
description: The dual pressures of climate change and plastic pollution are frequently conflated in the media, in peer-reviewed research and other environmental reporting.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Scientists close the cycle on recycling mixed plastics
description: Little of the mixed consumer plastics thrown away or placed in recycle bins actually ends up being recycled. Nearly 90% is buried in landfills or incinerated at commercial facilities that generate greenhouse gases and airborne toxins. Neither outcome is ideal for the environment.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Black holes could come in 'perfect pairs' in an ever expanding universe
description: Researchers from the University of Southampton, together with colleagues from the universities of Cambridge and Barcelona, have shown it's theoretically possible for black holes to exist in perfectly balanced pairs—held in equilibrium by a cosmological force—mimicking a single black hole.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Visitors tour New Mexico atomic site in likely record attendance fueled by 'Oppenheimer' fanfare
description: Visitors lined up Saturday to tour the southern New Mexico site where the world's first atomic bomb was detonated in what officials believe could be a record turnout amid ongoing fanfare surrounding Christopher Nolan's blockbuster film, " Oppenheimer."
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Drought in Brazil's Amazon reveals ancient engravings
description: An extreme drought in parts of the Amazon has led to a dramatic drop in river water levels, exposing dozens of usually submerged rock formations with carvings of human forms that may date back some 2,000 years.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Climate 'loss and damage' talks end in failure
description: A crucial meeting on climate "loss and damages" ahead of COP28 ended in failure Saturday, with countries from the global north and south unable to reach an agreement, according to sources involved in the talks.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Storm Babet triggers flooding, power cuts in northern Europe
description: Deadly Storm Babet unleashed extensive flooding and damaged towns in Denmark and Norway into Saturday, while continuing to sweep across the UK.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
